Title: Kickoff: confirm scope, page list (<10), and demo success criteria
Body:
## Summary
Align on the *exact* POC scope and what “done” means for the demo.

## Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Confirm the page list is **<= 10 pages**
- [ ] Confirm what is **mocked** (payment + QR) and what is **real** (barcode scan + points accrual)
- [ ] Agree on the demo script (happy path) and test data needs
- [ ] Record decisions in README / docs

## Notes
Keep the POC non-production: prioritize fast learning + working demo over perfection.
Findings: No scope/decision doc found; README is still the Vite template.

Title: Repo hygiene: eslint/prettier, conventional commits, env var template, basic folder structure
Body:
## Summary
Standardize the repo so 5 people can work in parallel with minimal friction.

## Acceptance criteria
- [ ] ESLint + Prettier configured and running
- [ ] `README` includes local dev steps
- [ ] `.env.example` added (no secrets committed)
- [ ] Folder structure agreed (e.g., `src/pages`, `src/components`, `src/lib`, `convex/`)

## Notes
Aim for “good enough” conventions that reduce merge conflicts.
Findings: ESLint config exists; no Prettier; no .env.example; README not updated for this app.

Title: Scaffold app: Vite + React + TS + Router + ShadCN UI baseline
Body:
## Summary
Create the baseline web app and UI kit plumbing.

## Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Vite + React + TypeScript app runs locally
- [ ] Routing in place for planned pages
- [ ] ShadCN UI installed + one sample page using components
- [ ] Global layout + theme basics (light/dark optional)

## Notes
Keep to the planned page list (<=10).
Findings: Vite + React + TS + router present; shadcn-style UI components in src/ui; needs run verification.

Title: Convex setup: project init, local dev flow, and React client connection
Body:
## Summary
Initialize Convex and wire it into the React app.

## Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Convex project created and running locally
- [ ] React app can call at least one Convex query
- [ ] Dev workflow documented (how to run both frontend + Convex)

## Notes
Prefer simple patterns (queries/mutations) over over-engineering.
Findings: convex/ folder exists with sample query, but no schema.ts, no Convex client/provider, and no convex pkg in package.json.

Title: Auth: integrate Clerk + protected routes + user context
Body:
## Summary
Integrate external authentication (Clerk) and protect app routes.

## Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Clerk configured (dev keys in `.env`)
- [ ] Login flow works
- [ ] Protected routes redirect to login
- [ ] User info available to app + Convex calls (if needed)

## Notes
Keep auth minimal—just enough to identify a user and store points.
Findings: No Clerk dependency or provider; /login is a placeholder page.

Title: Capacitor bootstrap: wrap web app, Android platform, and build an installable APK (dev)

## Notes
This is a POC—debug APK is acceptable unless you want a release APK later.

Title: Spike: decide barcode scanning approach (Capacitor plugin vs web scanner) + quick Android POC
Body:
## Summary
Choose the fastest reliable way to scan barcodes on Android for the POC.

## Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Evaluate 1–2 approaches (Capacitor barcode plugin vs JS camera scanner)
- [ ] Demo scan -> returns barcode string on Android device/emulator
- [ ] Decision recorded + minimal implementation plan

## Notes
If camera scanning is flaky, include manual entry fallback.
Findings: No scanner decision recorded; no Capacitor barcode plugin or web scanner implemented.

Title: Feature: barcode scan flow (camera) + manual entry fallback + permissions UX
Body:
## Summary
Implement product barcode scanning in the app.

## Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Scan using camera (barcode) returns a code string
- [ ] Manual entry fallback works (keyboard)
- [ ] Handle permission denied gracefully
- [ ] Works inside Capacitor Android build

## Notes
Keep UI simple; reliability > fancy UI.
Findings: ScanningFlow UI + manual barcode entry exist; camera scanning + permissions not implemented.

Title: Backend: define data model (products, user profile, scans, checkout, points ledger, rewards)
Body:
## Summary
Create Convex schema/tables and basic invariants.

## Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Product includes: barcode, name, health flag/score, cashback amount
- [ ] User profile includes: current points balance (derived ok) and references
- [ ] Points ledger records: earned/spent, reason, timestamps
- [ ] Rewards include: name, cost points, description, image URL (optional)

## Notes
Prefer ledger + computed balance (safer than mutating balance directly).
Findings: No schema.ts; Convex data model is permissive (auto-generated warning).

Body:

Findings: No seed scripts; only static rewards array in src/data.
